itemDescription: British civil servant; Governor of Madras

wikipedia_page.main: William Ambrose Morehead (17 October 1805 – 1 December 1863) was a British civil servant of the Indian civil service who acted as the Governor of Madras for two terms in 1860 and 1860–61.

response: * William Ambrose Morehead (1805–1863) governor of Madras (gravestone badly damaged, but a huge separate memorial exists)

link_mentions.page: List of colonial governors and presidents of Madras Presidency

response: ** Robert Morehead's son William Ambrose Morehead (1805–1863), Scottish member of the Indian Civil Service who acted as the Governor of Madras
He was married to Margaret Wilson. Their children included William Ambrose Morehead and Charles Morehead FRSE (1807-1882) an authority on tropical diseases.

He was born in Edinburgh on 8 February 1807 the son of Margaret (née Wilson) and Rev Dr Robert Morehead DD. He was younger brother to William Ambrose Morehead. The family lived at 1 Hill Street in Edinburgh's New Town.Edinburgh Post Office Directory 1810
In 1768 he married Isabella Lockhart. Their children included Robert Morehead and his grandchildren included William Ambrose Morehead and Dr Charles Morehead, both eminent figures in India.
*William Ambrose Morehead (1805–1863), Governor of Madras from 1860 to 1861
